Utterance: Hi there! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been doing well! I tried the mindfulness exercise a few times, and it really helped.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it feel to incorporate mindfulness into your routine?
It was calming, especially during stressful moments. I felt more centered.
That’s great progress! Have you noticed any changes in your anxiety levels?
I think so. I’ve been less anxious about the move, which is a relief.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re adapting well. How did your visit with your brother go?
We watched a movie together, and it felt nice to just hang out. I think it brought us a little closer.
That’s a significant step! How did you feel during and after the visit?
I felt happy during the movie, and afterward, I was relieved. I realized that spending time with him doesn’t have to be complicated.
Exactly! Simple moments can create lasting connections. Do you think you’ll continue to make time for him?
Yes, I want to. I think I’ll try to visit him more often.
That’s a great intention. As you continue to build that relationship, how do you think it will impact you?
I hope it will help me feel more connected to my family overall. It’s important to me.
Absolutely. Family connections can be very fulfilling. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been thinking about my upcoming move and how it’ll affect my kids.
That’s a valid concern. What specific worries do you have regarding the move?
I’m worried about how they’ll adjust to a new environment and school. I want them to feel secure.
It’s understandable to want that for them. Have you thought about ways to help them during the transition?
I think we’ll talk to them about it more and maybe visit the area before we move.
Those are excellent ideas. Open communication can help them feel more secure. What else could you do to support them?
Maybe involve them in the packing process and let them choose some things to bring. I think that would make them feel included.
That’s a wonderful approach! Involving them can help them feel more in control of the situation. How are you feeling about the move overall?
I’m feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. I want it to be a positive experience for everyone.
That’s completely normal. Balancing excitement and nerves is part of major life changes. It sounds like you’re taking thoughtful steps to ensure a smooth transition.
I hope so. I just want what’s best for my family.

Your intentions are clear, and that’s a great foundation. As we wrap up today, let’s set a goal for you to have an open conversation with your kids about the move and involve them in the packing process. How does that sound?
That sounds perfect! I’ll make sure to do that.
Excellent! I look forward to hearing how it goes in our next session. Thank you for sharing your thoughts today.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate it!
Goodbye!
Goodbye!
